net.jakubholy.dbunitexpress.impl
Class EnhancedDatabaseTesterDecorator

java.lang.Object
  net.jakubholy.dbunitexpress.impl.EnhancedDatabaseTesterDecorator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEnhancedDatabaseTester, org.dbunit.IDatabaseTester
public class EnhancedDatabaseTesterDecorator
extends Object
implements IEnhancedDatabaseTester

A decorator that adds the additional methods defined by IEnhancedDatabaseTester to any IDatabaseTester.

Author:
jholy

Method Detail

replaceDatabase

public void replaceDatabase(String dataSetFile)
                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                            org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException,
                            org.dbunit.dataset.DataSetException
Description copied from interface: IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Replace the content of the database from the provided data set XML file. This is useful e.g. if, for a particular test method, you need some special data in the database and you don't want to create a new test class for that. This method does the same database re-initialization that happens in DatabaseTestCase.setUp().

Consider this to be an experimental method that may have yet undiscovered side effects on DbUnit's state and behavior and use at your own risk.

Usage example


 public void testFetchData_emtpyTable() throws Exception {
                this.replaceDatabase("TestData/empty_data_set.xml");
                // Call the tested method
                final List data = this.target.fetchData();
                // Verify results
                assertEquals("empty data set => shall be empty", 0, data.size());
 }

 // other test method may use the default data set w/o calling replaceDatabase

Specified by:
replaceDatabase in interface IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Parameters:
dataSetFile - (required) File name of a DbUnit Data Set XML
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - If the provided string isn't an existing file's name
org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException - thrown as Exception by IDatabaseTester.onSetup()
org.dbunit.dataset.DataSetException - thrown by XmlDataSet.XmlDataSet(java.io.InputStream)

replaceDatabase

public void replaceDatabase(org.dbunit.dataset.IDataSet newDataSet)
                     throws org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException
Description copied from interface: IEnhancedDatabaseTester
See IEnhancedDatabaseTester.replaceDatabase(String) for detailed description, here we only describe the differences.

This variant replaces the data by the provided Data Set - which may be constructed programmatically - instead of loading them from a .xml file.

Example


 import org.dbunit.dataset.*;
 import org.dbunit.dataset.datatype.DataType;

 final DefaultTable table = new DefaultTable("my_test_schema.my_test_table", new Column[]{
                        new Column("id", DataType.INTEGER)
                        , new Column("some_text", DataType.VARCHAR) });
 table.addRow( new Object[] {new Integer(1), "hello!"} );

 final DefaultDataSet dataSet = new DefaultDataSet(table);
 this.replaceDatabase( dataSet );

Specified by:
replaceDatabase in interface IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Parameters:
newDataSet - (required) the data set used to replace the data with
Throws:
org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException - thrown as Exception by IDatabaseTester.onSetup()

clearTable

public void clearTable(String tableName)
                throws SQLException
Description copied from interface: IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Remove all data from the given test table. This is useful e.g. if you want to verify that your code behaves correctly when there are no data.

Specified by:
clearTable in interface IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Parameters:
tableName - Table name in the form used by the underlying tester, i.e. either fully qualified (schema.table) or unqualified (only table) - likely same as in your data set XML file
Throws:
SQLException

getDataSource

public DataSource getDataSource()
                         throws org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException
Description copied from interface: IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Returns a data source connected to the test database configured for this DbUnit test. This is an alternative of IDatabaseTester.getConnection() for providing access to the database to the classes under test that need a DataSource instead of a Connection (which is often the case when using Spring).

The data source uses this database tester underneath.

Specified by:
getDataSource in interface IEnhancedDatabaseTester
Throws:
org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException
